Asset.title: Microsoft Office
Asset.description: Microsoft Office is an office suite of desktop applications, servers and services for the Microsoft Windows and Mac operating systems. It includes Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook and OneNote. Microsoft Office is standard on all KU-owned workstations for faculty and staff. This asset includes M365 with locally stored documents.

Vulnerabilities.title: Back-up Validation, Process & Standards
Vulnerabilities.description: There are backups; however there is no apparent backup policy which could lead to broken standards and potentail failure in backup avaliability.

Threats.title: Electronic Communication Mishandling
Threats.description: There is a threat of data leakage if an email is distributed or handed without proper care of due diligence, e.g., non encrypted email attachments.

Threats.title: Dependency System Outage
Threats.description: There is a risk of multiple system outage, because of the system dependencies due to cyberattack.

Threats.title: Phishing (Sophisticated)
Threats.description: A targeted e-mail containing information relevant to CLIENT NAME staff or contractor (e.g., 'Spear Phishing') successfully exploits the trust of the person in order to obtain their account credentials or deliver malware or ransomware.

Threats.title: Ransomware
Threats.description: An adversary gains administrative access to CLIENT NAME's system(s) and disables their function or encrypts key data, then demands payment to restore services.

Vulnerabilities.title: Standardized Disaster Recovery Policy & Process
Vulnerabilities.description: DR plan does exist however more governance and process should be in pace related to business continuity planning

Threats.title: Electronic Communication Mishandling
Threats.description: There is a threat of data leakage if an email is distributed or handed without proper care of due diligence, e.g., non encrypted email attachments.

Threats.title: Phishing (Sophisticated)
Threats.description: A targeted e-mail containing information relevant to CLIENT NAME staff or contractor (e.g., 'Spear Phishing') successfully exploits the trust of the person in order to obtain their account credentials or deliver malware or ransomware.

Threats.title: Ransomware
Threats.description: An adversary gains administrative access to CLIENT NAME's system(s) and disables their function or encrypts key data, then demands payment to restore services.

Threats.title: Phishing (Unsophisticated)
Threats.description: FUnlike Sophisticated phishing, this threat relates to a generic phishing e-mail successfully compromising CLIENT NAME's account credentials, or delivering malware or ransomware. A generic, non-targeted phishing e-mail sent to a number of employs successfully compromises employee or contractor account credentials or delivers malware or ransomware.

Threats.title: Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS)
Threats.description: A large number of automated processes make requests to CLIENT NAME's web services simultaneously, overwhelming the web server or the on-premises back-end systems, causing failures or making performance unacceptable.

Threats.title: Privileged Access Abuse (Administrator)
Threats.description: A CLIENT NAME employee with privileged or administrative access abuses, modify or destroy large volumes of data or formulas, or lock users out of systems or bring entire systems offline.

Asset.title: File Server - User Data
Asset.description: This asset represents a server which holds and controls access to separately stored files, as part of a multiuser system.
